title: Domain 4.9: Given a scenario, use data sources to support an investigation.
content:
ğŸ”¥ Firewall Logs

Show incoming and outgoing trafficâ€”useful for detecting unauthorized access or unusual patterns.

ğŸ“ Application Logs

Record events from applicationsâ€”help trace errors, crashes, and suspicious activity within the app.

ğŸ“± Endpoint Logs

Provide information from user devicesâ€”tracks activities like logins, file access, or malware activity.

ğŸ’» OS-Specific Security Logs

Logs generated by the operating systemâ€”important for identifying system-level security incidents.

ğŸ›¡ï¸ IPS/IDS Logs

Logs from Intrusion Prevention or Detection Systemsâ€”alert on suspicious traffic or known attack signatures.

ğŸŒ Network Logs

Capture data about network trafficâ€”important for spotting DDoS attacks, unauthorized access attempts, or lateral movement.

ğŸ—‚ï¸ Metadata

Data about data (e.g., file timestamps, IPs, file size)â€”useful for tracking file movements or unauthorized access.

ğŸ“Š Data Sources

ğŸ•µï¸ Vulnerability Scans

Automated scans that identify weaknesses in systems, applications, or networksâ€”help prioritize patching or remediation.

ğŸ“‘ Automated Reports

Pre-scheduled reports that give insights into system health, vulnerabilities, or incident trends.

ğŸ“‰ Dashboards

Visual representations of security metricsâ€”help analysts monitor security posture and detect anomalies.

ğŸ“¡ Packet Captures

Detailed data of network trafficâ€”helps in deep packet analysis to identify malicious or suspicious communication.
